remarks: The base set of the fundamental group.  (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 10-Jul-2015.)
statement:
pi1val.g $e |- G = ( J pi1 Y ) $.
pi1val.1 $e |- ( ph -> J e. ( TopOn ` X ) ) $.
pi1val.2 $e |- ( ph -> Y e. X ) $.
pi1bas2.b $e |- ( ph -> B = ( Base ` G ) ) $.
pi1bas3.r $e |- R = ( ( ~=ph ` J ) i^i ( U. B X. U. B ) ) $.
pi1bas3 $p |- ( ph -> B = ( U. B /. R ) ) $.
